sub_title: Master's student at Wageningen University and Research
summary: I have a strong interest in smart and sustainable animal production through innovative solutions. With roots in social development and special communication skills, I enjoy collaborating with teams to produce better and in more sustainable ways. I am a specialist in transferring information (technical and sales-based) to clients, farmers and businesses.

awards.title: Best classmate award
awards.description: A special award in Zamorano to a unique classmate who demonstrate lidership, kindness, respect and sense of helping the other. This award was given by a class of 376 people.

awards.title: Bronze Medal at iGEM
awards.description:
This global contest has the purpose of modifying synthetic organisms, adding specific characteristics that allow them to be useful for a given action.

Member and co-founder of Zamorano iGEM team. Our team was part in the modification and risk assessment of “E. zamofordi” an E. coli capable of detecting cupper in water.

The competition had 240 teams participating in several synthetic biology topics such as medicine, environmental science, energy, soils, plants, etc.

awards.title: Delegate at Youth Ag-Summit
awards.description: I am one of the 100 young people worldwide who is attending this international forum In Brusels. My  idea is the neccesity of give the producers easy technology to  increase the useful life of fruits and vegetables.

awards.title: National award in oratory
awards.description: During my years in high school, I won 5 different awards in oratory including a fourth place at a National Level.

projects.title: Reduce food insecurity in children at El Pedregal town
projects.description: Food security project focused on 47 mothers of Francisco Morazán (Honduras). The project scope focused on teaching mothers safety practices in preserving fruits and vegetables using environmentaly friendly tecnhology as solar driers.

profile_positions.description:
•	Technical assistance to farmers and field workers in Ecuador. Field visits, analysis of variables in the field, and specific recommendations to maintain and improve milk production.
•	Financial and budget analysis and projections. Creation of strategies to increase the market and maintain client portfolio and stakeholder partnerships.
profile_positions.title: Field technician on livestock management

profile_positions.description:
The Norwegian Refugee Council is an independent humanitarian organization helping people forced to flee.
As the only logistics staff in Ecuador I implement and report the entire NRC logistics operation for each project/office including warehouse reports, vehicles use, and assets register.
•Humanitarian crisis context. Projects related to education, shelter, nutrition, water sanitization, and crisis respond were implemented on people forced to flee.
profile_positions.title: Logistics Technical Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Gray Matters Capital (GMC) is an impact investment firm that actively funds sustainable, replicable business models that benefit under-served populations in developing countries.

I work with the edLABS pre-investment and post-investment teams. Under pre-investment, I provide strategy inputs, develop criteria for investee selection, conduct due diligence on applications, and prepare pitches to the investment committee. Under post-investment, I support the team in streamlining internal processes, provide support to investee companies as required, and help in strategizing and reviewing post-investment functions on a timely basis.
profile_positions.title: IDEX Fellow

profile_positions.description: Tankay comes from the quechua (native language of Ecuador) that means “help”. We export uvilla (Physalis peruviana) growed by small farmers (mainly women) in the ecuadorian Andes . We have the certification GLOBAL GAP that guarantee our correct trade with the people, environment and quality of production.  I organize and give technical assistance, workshops, conferences and forums to 160 families in three provinces in Ecuador (Pichincha, Cotopaxi and Imbabura)
profile_positions.title: Production Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description:
One of the 25 leaders selected from 25 different countries by the SheDecides global, political movement that aims to create a world where women and girls can decide for themselves, without question.

Participation as a panelist in WomenDeliver (Vancouver, Canada) the biggest conference about gender equality, the General Assembly of the United Nations (New York, USA) and the International Conference on Development and Population (Nairobi, Kenya).
This project aims to empower women in vulnerable situations spreading information and creating action programs focused on their specific necessities/goals.

I was selected as one of the thousand Global Sustainable Development Goal Talents (aka Unleashers) from over 10,000 applicants from 165+ countries to participate in a fully-sponsored innovation lab in August 2017 in Denmark. We will work and co-create innovative, implementable, and scalable solutions to the SDG's, looking to put them into action after the lab while building a strong network of forward-thinking people.
What is UNLEASH ?
UNLEASH is a global sustainability initiative that will bring together young leaders, experts, and entrepreneurs annually to accelerate breakthrough solutions for the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG). 

Who supports this innovative lab?
UNLEASH is supported by ‘a global consortium of actors across sectors, including the United Nations Global Compact, Dalberg, Microsoft, Deloitte, Novo Nordisk Foundation, Carlsberg Foundation and more than 150 knowledge and talent partners from all around the world’ including Masdar Institute, The Yunus Social Business, One Young World and Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

What did I do?
My project’s team focused on empowering women in rural areas of developing countries in order to preserve the food for their children was nominated as Impact Global Award (only 8 projects of 199 were nominated worldwide).

Ecuadorian Delegate at the 2017 Youth Ag Summit
Selected as one of the 100 young leaders in Agriculture to attend the Youth Ag-Summit 2017. 

The Youth Ag-Summit is a week-long event that serves as a forum for young leaders to discuss opportunities, collaborate and find answers and solutions to the question “How do we feed a hungry planet?” 

Three Summits have taken place to date: Calgary, Canada in 2013; Canberra, Australia in 2015; Brussels, Belgium in 2017. During the Summit, delegates share their diverse experiences and work together to generate innovative, sustainable and actionable solutions to global food security challenges. Across five days, they undertake group projects and participate in industry tours, as well as learning from expert guest speakers. Their mission is to come up with concrete new ideas which can drive agricultural progress across the globe and be put into practice back home.

Link: https://lahora.com.ec/quito/noticia/1102114548/valeria-guerrero-la-ecuatoriana-que-tiene-un-plan-contra-el-hambre-en-todo-el-mundo-
•	Sharing expertise in farming and learning about nursery care to homeless men with HIV in Batu Arang, Malasya.

•	Attended one-month intensive project with the aim of disrupting prevailing prejudice and discrimination between Colombian refugees and Ecuadorian citizens. 
•	Part of the group “Ambassadors for Peace” with 30 participants aged 16-18 to continue the project. The group’s goal is to promote understanding and reconciliation between both parties.
